Hi Craig - 

Yes, I would say the good old economy has put a lot of us on hold for awhile. Both of those books are super and I'm sure any buyers will be thrilled to get them at a great  price. Unfortunately, I bought my copies as they became available, but hey, I'm happy. I still remember your display of books at one of the shows. I couldn't imagine going through all that work of transporting all that "weight." Made me think of the old days when my wife and I used to bring all those books and stuff to shows for the JSS/US. Makes my back hurt just thinking of it! 

Hope sales pick up, for books and for our for sale swords and fittings! 

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Craig Harris 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, January 22, 2010 6:55 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Book Sale 50% Off


    
  On Fri, Jan 22, 2010 at 5:27 PM, Ron Hartmann <swords@...> wrote:

  >
  >
  > Holy cow...guess I shouldn't bother bringing my Goto copy to Tampa to
  > sell...you're giving these away!
  >
  > Ron
  > STL
  >
  Ron,

  I'm not going to Tampa, haven't been in a number of years, so I won't be
  there to compete with your copy in person.

  If you're driving and have room, throw it in. I never had the time to drive,
  so the economics of being a bookseller anywhere except the Chicago show
  never worked for me.

  As far as the pricing, it's all supply and demand, and I have more supply
  than I need, and haven't found anyone willing to take books for food,
  tuition, etc.

  See you in Chicago!

  Regards,

  Craig

  -- 
  Craig Harris
  Bridge of Dreams, LLC
  Books from and about Asia
  www.bridgeofdreams.com
  Member, IOBA, Independent Online Booksellers Association
  Member, MWABA, Midwest Antiquarian Booksellers Association
